definition: to follow with one's eyes (a departing guest etc)
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: I gaze after teacher, vanishes until she that beautiful back in the dim light of night.
sentences.chinese: 我目送老师，直到她那美丽的背影消失在夜色中。

sentences.english: Early autumn of the morning breeze, we watched the unfurling of the fly ash so the car away.
sentences.chinese: 早秋的晨风，就这么目送着扬起了飞尘的汽车远去。

sentences.english: This is the writer, 'tai' in the "watched."
sentences.chinese: 这是作家‘龙应台’的《目送》。

sentences.english: Mr. Darcy handed the ladies into the carriage, and when it drove off, Elizabeth saw him walking slowly towards the house.
sentences.chinese: 直到马车开驶，伊丽莎白还目送他慢慢儿走进屋去。

sentences.english: Calixta, on the gallery, watched Alcée ride away.
sentences.chinese: 卡利克斯塔站在门廊上目送阿尔西骑马离去。

sentences.english: Standing on the platform Lucy looked after her son getting into the train.
sentences.chinese: 露希鹄立在站台上，目送着儿子登上列车。

sentences.english: A feeling of sadness and joy filled the air, as they watched E.
sentences.chinese: 在悲喜交加的气氛中，他们目送E。

definition: rear view/figure seen from behind/view of the back (of a person or object)
reluctant to part (idiom); broken-hearted at having to leave
to gaze at/to stare fixedly at
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to swagger off/to walk off (or drive off etc) without a second thought for those left behind
gradually proceed, gradually get further apart
